intro: Dortmanna ocimoides, commonly known as the sweet pepper plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically harvested when they are green or turn red, depending on the variety. It is native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa, often growing in dry, rocky soils. The plant is valued for its culinary uses and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
